st:Description.name: ConstraintsAndDimensions
st:Description.st:role: Setting to manage Constraints and Dimensions visualization options
st:Description.st:detailedRole: Constraints and Dimensions setting contains all options necessary to manage Constraints and Dimensions visualization

st:attribute.Name: Filter_ActivePartOnly
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Attribute to define combination of settings on Constraint Filter panel.

st:default.st:role: By default, two check boxes under Product are un-checked.

st:attribute.Name: Dim3dFilterStatus
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Attribute to define combination of settings on Constraint Filter panel.

st:default.st:role: By default, all 11 checkboxes are checked and grayed out

st:attribute.Name: Filter_Distance
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether dimension constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the dimension constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Filter_Angle
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether angles constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the angles constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Filter_FixedAngle
st:attribute.st:role: Attribute to display fixed angles constraints
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether fixed angles constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the fixed angles constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Filter_Tangency
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether tangency constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the tangency constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Filter_Coincidence
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether coincidence constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the coincidence constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Filter_Equality
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether equal constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the equal constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Filter_Fixity
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether fix constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the fix constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Filter_Concentric
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether concentricity constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the concentricity constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Filter_Chamfer
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether chamfer constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the chamfer constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Filter_Measured
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether driven constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the driven constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Filter_Constrained
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether driving constraints are displayed.

st:default.st:role: By default the driving constraints are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Overrun
st:attribute.st:role: Attribute to define the distance between the constraint dimension lines and constraint extension lines
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines the distance between the constraint dimension lines and constraint extension lines, in mm.

st:default.st:role: By default the view angle is 2 mm

st:attribute.Name: Gap
st:attribute.st:role: Attribute to define the distance between the constrained geometries and constraint extension lines
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines the distance between the constrained geometries and constraint extension lines, in mm.

st:default.st:role: By default the view angle is 2 mm

st:attribute.Name: Hilite_pointed_elements
st:attribute.st:role: Attribute to highlight the constrained geometries
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether the constrained geometries are highlighted when you pre-select a constraint.

st:enum.st:role: The constrained geometries are not highlighted

st:default.st:role: By default the constrained geometries are highlighted

st:attribute.Name: Show_iconic_line
st:attribute.st:role: Attribute to display the iconified constrained elements
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether the iconified constrained elements are displayed.

st:enum.st:role: Does not display iconified constrained elements

st:default.st:role: By default iconified constrained elements are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Scale
st:attribute.st:role: Attribute to define the dimension style options
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines the size of the graphical symbols for iconic constraint.

st:default.st:role: By default medium symbols are displayed

st:attribute.Name: Display_Param_Mode
st:attribute.st:role: Attribute to Display Mode available as Knowledge parameter
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines whether Display Mode available as Knowledge parameter.

st:enum.st:role: Display Mode not available as Knowledge parameter
Display Mode available as Knowledge parameter

st:default.st:role: By default Display Mode not available as Knowledge parameter

st:attribute.Name: Display_Mode
st:attribute.st:role: Attribute to define the constraint display mode
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines the constraint display mode.

st:enum.st:role: The constraint value and name are displayed
The constraint valuen name and formula are displayed

st:default.st:role: By default only the constraint value is displayed

st:attribute.Name: Angle
st:attribute.st:role: Attribute to define the constraint view angle
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines the angle in degrees from which the constraint is displayed in the geometry area, when you are rotating the geometry. This angle is measured between the normal to the screen and the constraint direction.

st:default.st:role: By default the view angle is 1 deg

st:attribute.Name: Show_Color_Status
st:attribute.st:role: Attribute to display the status color
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: Defines if the default status color or the graphical user defined color is displayed on constraint.

st:enum.st:role: The graphical user defined color is used
The Update command will be automatically launched

st:default.st:role: By default the default status color is used

st:attribute.Name: Status_geoinv
st:attribute.st:role: Invalid Geometry Constraints color in 3D viewer
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: This attribute defines the color status for constraints set on a geometry became invalid in the 3D viewer. The three integer are the Red, Green, Blue coefficients

st:default.st:role: By default, the color is dark red

st:attribute.Name: Status_overcst
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: This attribute defines the color status for overconstrained in the 3D viewer. The three integer are the Red, Green, Blue coefficients

st:default.st:role: By default, the color is purple

st:attribute.Name: Status_ko
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: This attribute defines the color status for unresolved constraints in the 3D viewer. The three integer are the Red, Green, Blue coefficients

st:default.st:role: By default, the color is dark green

st:attribute.Name: Status_ok
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: This attribute defines the color status for resolved constraints in the 3D viewer. The three integer are the Red, Green, Blue coefficients

st:default.st:role: By default, the color is medium green
